name: Item$Builder
description: The `Item$Builder` class is a nested builder within `Item` that provides a fluent API for creating and configuring `Item` instances.
overview:
The `Item$Builder` class is a nested builder within `Item` that provides a fluent API for creating and configuring `Item` instances. This builder implements the builder pattern, allowing you to construct item render elements with all their properties set through a chainable, readable API.

The builder is the recommended way to create `Item` instances for 2D rendering, as it provides type safety, method chaining, and validation during the construction process. It's typically accessed through the `Draw2D` context's `item()` method.

constructors.description: The builder constructor creates an empty builder that will construct an `Item` instance. In most cases, you won't call this constructor directly - instead, you'll obtain a builder through the `Draw2D.item()` method.

methods.name: pos
methods.description: Sets both x and y positions simultaneously.

methods.name: x
methods.description: Sets the x-coordinate of the item.
examples:
const builder = draw2D.item()
    .x(150); // Position at x=150

methods.name: y
methods.description: Sets the y-coordinate of the item.
examples:
const builder = draw2D.item()
    .y(75); // Position at y=75

methods.name: item
methods.description: Sets the item using a Minecraft item ID string.

methods.name: item
methods.description: Sets the item using an ItemStackHelper instance.

methods.name: id
methods.description: Alternative method for setting the item ID.

methods.name: scale
methods.description: Sets the scale factor for the item. Scale affects the visual size of the rendered item.

methods.name: rotation
methods.description: Sets the rotation angle for the item in degrees. Positive values rotate clockwise.
examples:
const builder = draw2D.item()
    .rotation(45); // Rotate 45 degrees clockwise

methods.name: rotateCenter
methods.description: Sets whether rotation should occur around the item's center point or origin (top-left corner).

parameters.name: rotateCenter
parameters.description: Whether to rotate around the center point

examples:
const builder = draw2D.item()
    .rotateCenter(true); // Rotate around center

methods.name: overlayVisible
methods.description: Sets whether the item overlay (count, durability, custom text) should be visible.

methods.name: overlayText
methods.description: Sets custom overlay text to display on the item. Set to null or empty string to use default behavior.
examples:
const builder = draw2D.item()
    .overlayText("âœ¨"); // Custom overlay text

methods.name: showOverlay
methods.description: Alternative method for setting overlay visibility.

methods.name: zIndex
methods.description: Sets the z-index for render ordering. Higher values appear on top of lower values.
examples:
const builder = draw2D.item()
    .zIndex(10); // Render above elements with lower z-index

methods.name: build
methods.description: Creates the `Item` with the configured properties but does not add it to the parent container.
examples:
const item = draw2D.item()
    .pos(100, 50)
    .item("minecraft:diamond")
    .scale(1.0)
    .build(); // Item is created but not added

methods.name: buildAndAdd
methods.description: Creates the `Item` with the configured properties and automatically adds it to the parent `Draw2D` context.
examples:
const item = draw2D.item()
    .pos(100, 50)
    .item("minecraft:diamond")
    .scale(1.0)
    .buildAndAdd(); // Item is created and added
